page.title: 14Lyneham Inn Plym.St.Mary.
page.content: This inn dates back to the 18th century,when it was a small 'watering hole' attached to a farmhouse.It has been extended over the years,but it is now{a listed building. It relied on the passing trade of the old A.38 and is completely isolated in somuch as its only neighbours are the farms scattered about.When the new A.38 was opened{trade fell off almost completely.However the positive approach of the landlady paid dividends.She turned the land behind the pub into a{garden area with seats and sun umbrellas.She installed a large{play area for children,}and soon people noticed the change from the road and{customers come from {Plymouth,Ivybridge}and the new housing development at{Plympton}to boost trade.
